page.title: 03OGBOURNE ST ANDREW FARM
page.content: The farm,925 acres of rolling open downland to the north-west of the village is owned by the Cadbury Schweppes Fund Pension and farmed by Mr Margesson,with 6 fulltime and 2 part-time workers.{Acres of crops and {grass:}winter wheat-297,winter barley- 98,spring barley-94,temporary grass- 184,peas-62,permanent grass-135,wood- land-20,for silage-70,for hay-15. {Livestock:}beef cattle-108,ewes-1200, rams-21,lambs-1500{Machinery:}1 bailer 4 tractors,1 combine,1 silage cutter, 1 plough,1 disc harrow,2 more harrows, 2 cultivators,1 seed drill,1 elevator, 1 spraying machine,1 bail sledge,1 hay turner,11 trailers,1 mower,1 grass topper,1 feed wagon. {For 1 acre of {winter wheat:}seed-75kg,fertiliser-155 units used 3 times,sprays-Â£60 worth used 4-6 times.Likely yield:3 tonnes an acre.
